column4: Are you sure you need a graphics card?  I find the integrated graphics on intel cpus good enough for all my needs, but having said that I am not into gaming. Also intel's drivers are not closed source like Nvidia.
using intel integrated right now, but I don't get screen tearing under control. that's why I want to try a dedicated one.

Fair enough.  Some people like Nvidia because it offers excellent performance including VDPAU.  However, to get the most out of it you need to install a binary blob of secret code which some users do not like to do.  There is an open source driver called "nouveau" but it's performance is vastly inferior to the proprietary driver from Nvidia unfortunately.
that tearing seems to be an issue specific to HD 3000 (sandy bridge integrated). found a thread talking about a driver bug some time ago. can't find the link right now, though.
